primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Living One (Christ) enters a space of fear and death (Empire) to breathe new life into his followers, transforming them from fearful subjects into a movement of civil disobedience and reconciliation.

tekstueel_bewijs: He gave them the surging gift of surprising life.

object.identificatie: Easter Life / Peace / Power to Forgive
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s power for life that is loosed in the world
the surging gift of surprising life
the God who gives the spirit of life to the world
We are on the receiving end from him of his offer of life
He gave them spirit. He performed artificial respiration.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Empire / The Power of Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the lifeless charade of the empire
the old weary forms of death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The Empire is not just a political entity here but a semiotic stand-in for the 'power of death' that seeks to fix reality and stifle life.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Breathed-on Church (Subject) engages in acts of civil disobedience and reconciliation (Object) against the Empire.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Apostles
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (Ethics/Mission) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (Soteriology/Resurrection). The church acts because it was 'breathed on'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He gave them the surging gift.
God raised Jesus from the dead.

voorbeelden: We must obey God rather than any human authority.
The church is restless for God’s call to life.
They recognized him when they saw the scars.
He gave them the power to forgive sin.
touched with the power for life.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of power (Pouvoir) rather than mere obligation (Devoir). The 'must' of obedience is presented as a consequence of the 'can' given by the Spirit.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Empire) and ~S1 (Fear) to S1 (Peace/Breath) and finally to ~S2 (Defiance/Doxology).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the physical presence of the Risen Christ who 'breaks' the closed system of the Empire.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the Empire is described as a violent, all-encompassing reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon maintains God/Christ as the primary initiator. Human action is framed as a 'witness' or 'response' to a prior act of 'artificial respiration' by Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are always deciding whether we shall be in denial...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: We are on the receiving end from him of his offer of life.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter and Thomas are used not as moral templates to emulate, but as representative types of the 'breathed-on' community.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God uses even the skeptical and the overeager.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; shifting from fear to 'exuberance'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of the 'Breath' (Soteriology) and the 'Obedience' (Ethics).
spanning_punten: The shift from 'receiving peace' to 'civil disobedience' requires a strong modal bridge which the sermon provides via the concept of 'Spirit'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The contradiction between the empire of death and the Living One whom the empire could not keep dead.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is identified with the 'Empire'—a systemic, death-dealing force.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative, with the church as the Receiver who then becomes a secondary Subject.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on the 'decision' (Vouloir) in section III.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure the 'deciding' is seen as a fruit of the 'breathing'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'deciding' sentences more closely to the 'Spirit' given in Section I.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Maintain the current flow: Christ Acts -> Church Receives -> Church Acts.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of grace-oriented homiletics that uses political imagery to ground cosmic victory in the life of the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Empire' metaphor, Greimas shows that the 'Empire' functions structurally as the Opponent that validates the Subject's power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek word 'pneuma'; Greimas focuses on how that 'pneuma' functions as a modal competence (Pouvoir).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'civil disobedience' is not a new law (Devoir) but a narrative performance enabled by the Sender's gift.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (came, stood, said, breathed, gave, charged)
The Empire (executed, could not keep dead, fears, resists, vetoes)
The Church/Apostles (recognized, knew, cured, cleansed, teach, obey, witness)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by framing the apostles' courage as a result of 'artificial respiration' rather than inherent grit.
